Materials and places where materials could be developed would
be located through correspondence and personal visits. Following the
initial contact and expression of interest, outlines of proposed in¬
formation kits would be developed. These outlines with examples of
existing materials would be evaluated by the NAEB Utilization Committee.
This evaluation would take place at a meeting of the Committee held in
conjunction with the NAEB 1960 Convention in San Francisco. A budget
for this phase is attached.
PHASE 2 - Development
Following the evaluation meeting specific production plans would
be worked out with organizations or individuals. A budget for this phas
will be developed and submitted after the plans are known. This budget
will be broken down into sections covering the production of each indi¬
vidual kit.
PHASE 3 - Production
Each producing agency would be responsible for meeting certain
deadlines and standards of production. The budget for this phase would
be a part of that developed in Phase 2. The completed kits would be re¬
viewed by the Utilization Committee before being released for distribu¬
tion.
PHASE 4 - Distribution
Materials would be distributed from NAEB Headquarters for short
term loan. Specific plans for distribution would be drawn up after the
nature of the material is known. The only budget item related to this
phase would be the duplication of the material in sufficient copies to
serve the requests.
IV. Approximate Time Schedule;
July 1, 1960 Project starting date.
November 1, 1960 Completion date for Phase 1.
January 1, 1961 Completion date for Phase 2.
April 1, 1961 Completion date for kit production
May 15, 1961 Completion of Phases 3 and 4.
June 30, 1961 Final report completed.
